pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:0.4: The sub-chapter on evenly all around
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:0.5: 6. The second training rule on well-restrained
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were playing with their hands and feet while sitting in inhabited areas. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:1.3.1: “‘I will sit well-restrained in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:1.4: One should be well-restrained while sitting in an inhabited area.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, plays with his hands or feet while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:1.12: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk6:1.13: The sixth training rule is finished.
